instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an A1706 820-00923-A, that after replacing de display, it stooped working. Already replaced with a known good lcd, and ot doesn't power on.

I has 19.5V on ampmeter, and consumes around 0.55 A to 0.86 A (only board. Full assembled and with battery it gets to around 2A).  CPU gets hot, but it seams to don't have CPU activity, because the caps lock doesn't turn on, and doesn't show any image on external monitor.
Can't see any damage components on board.

PPVCC_S0_CPU = 1V
PPVCC_CPU PH1/2 = 1V
PPDCPRTC_PCH= 1.6V
PPVCCGT = 0V

What should i check?

Can you help?

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
Check for knocked off components.
Was the battery disconnected???

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
Yes the battery was disconected, and there are no  knocked off components.

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
The board cannot die by itself.
There was wrong manipulation.

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message: That is my problem. I can't see anything wrong... maybe it was static electricity or something like that. Do you have any idea of what / where should I start taking measures? I already spend hours looking and I really can't see any knocked off components...

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
You should note some changes on the VCC_S0_CPU.
If starts and stays at 1V, board doesn't really boot.
You can compare its behavior with known good working board.

PLT_RESET_L comes high?
Test the board alone on the desk; no device connected.

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi, thank you.

Full assembled it responds to the SMC Reset on the keyboard and the fans start spining, but it doesn't do anything else.

With board alone i get:
VCC_S0_CPU oscillates between 1.08V and 1.09V and doesn't drop to 0V.
PLT_RESET_L  = 3.3V

Already tried SMC bypass without success.

Can you help?

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message: Can anyone help?

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
Damage induced when the LCD assembly was changed.
Should be mechanical problem, like broken trace, or knocked off components.

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
Thank you!.
I already spend hours looking on the microscope, and I can't see anything wrong. Can I measure something to figure out the area that i should look deeper? 
Is there any way to narow down the area? 
I really can't see nothing wrong on the board and don't know what else to do...

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message: Try known good BIOS, just in case...

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message: tks. Couldn't find no Clean ME on the forum. Do you have it please?

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
Try this one.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gNsZx1_Z9rQZsv42jUYMgQB1UqWepguW/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
Thanks.
After install the Clean ME, it has the same behavier (doesn't boot), but now one of the fans boots at full rpm and the other fan is stoped.  VCC_S0_CPU  is at 1.08V steady...
What else should i do?

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
Test again with original BIOS.
See if changes behavior.

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
After installing the original BIOS, the laptop has similar, btut different,  behavier (no fan spin and 1.08V on  VCC_S0_CPU )

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
Im having the exact same issue right now. (Ship in repair)

My client stated that he did a screen replacement. After screen replacement, he stated touchbar did not work. So when he was disconnecting flexes, he heard a chime, at which point he realized that the battery was still connected. Very similar behavior. I get fan spin when CPU gets hot enough, board seems to be booting, but no internal or external image. I am getting 1v06 on VCC_S0_CPU, and then it drops to about .640v after about 10 seconds or so.  PLT_RESET_L is a steady 3v3

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message: You should have USB activity in this case.

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
Who should have USB  activity ? Me or Dusten04?
I don't have any USB  activity .
After installing the original BIOS, the laptop has similar, but different,  behavier (no fan spin and 1.08V steady on  VCC_S0_CPU). Do you have any other idea about what can be wrong in my case?

threads.title: A1706 820-00923-A no boot
threads.message:
No activity possible, if CPU core voltage stays fixed at 1.08V.

Dusten04, please open other thread, to avoid confusions.
